results.name: Numerators of s(i) = s(i-1) - (1/i)*sign(s(i-1)) with s(1) = 1.
comment: Similar to harmonic series, but with signs chosen to minimize the absolute value of the next term.
link: Hugo Pfoertner, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
Hugo Pfoertner, Illustration of A203810(i)/A203811(i) for i<=100
Hugo Pfoertner, Illustration of A203810(i)/A203811(i) for even i, i<=500
example: s(1)=1, to minimize abs(s(2)) 1/2 has to be subtracted. s(2)=1-1/2=1/2. Similar for s(3) and s(4): s(3)=s(2)-1/3=1/2-1/3=1/6, s(4)=1/6-1/4=-1/12. Since s(4) is negative s(5)=s(4)+1/5=-1/12+1/5=7/60. The numerators of s(1)...s(5) are 1, 1, 1, -1, 7 and the corresponding denominators are 1, 2, 6, 12, 60.
